page.title: 08Local History Recent
page.content: The Royal Ornance Factory had formerly employed over 10,000 people when in 1947 it was taken over by Wales and Monmouthshire Estates Ltd. Of the 2,400 acres of land 1,700 was transferred to the Ministry of Agriculture and went back to its former use. Under the aegis of the Welsh Industrial Estates Corporation attempts were made to move away from the previously predominant coal and steel industries of the Wrexham area. The first factory to arrive was Johnson and Johnson, making surgical tissues. Others were British Celanese, Hunt's Capacitors and Consolidated Chemicals. Government aid brought the Firestone Tyre and Rubber Co. in 1967 as well as British Insulated Callender Cables, Fibreglass in 1970 and Kellogs in 1974. 6,000 people then worked on the estate, which has expanded since.
